alert.note: Alert for Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 05 at 3:37AM PST until February 06 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A winter storm is forecast to bring heavy snow to the Southern Blue Mountain passes. The heaviest snowfall is expected to occur between 4 AM this morning and 4 AM Monday. Expect lower snow accumulations of up to 1 inch in the mountain valleys along highway US-395 south of Pilot Rock to John Day.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.
